thread.title: LSU infielder Bryce Jordan out for rest of fall season
thread.title_full: LSU infielder Bryce Jordan out for rest of fall season

title: LSU infielder Bryce Jordan out for rest of fall season
text:
LSU infielder Bryce Jordan out for rest of fall season with torn meniscus THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   4:16   4:17   
Subjects: 

BATON ROUGE, Louisiana â€” LSU's infield just got a little thinner. 
Coach Paul Mainieri says sophomore infielder/catcher Bryce Jordan will miss the remainder of fall ball after tearing his meniscus while playing catch Wednesday. 
Mainieri on Friday told The Advocate ( http://bit.ly/1LYqMlG ) Jordan will have surgery Monday. He's expected to be fully recovered by the spring. 
Mainieri says the injury will require about six weeks of recovery. 
Before fall practice began Sunday, Mainieri said Jordan and junior college transfer Bryce Adams were the leading contenders at first base. LSU needs to replace every infielder from last year's team, and Mainieri said losing Jordan for the fall may slightly change how he handles the infield competition. 
Information from: The Advocate, http://theadvocate.com
